title: P85-1019

sentences.text: We have implemented a restricted domain parser called Plume .
Building on previous work at Carnegie-Mellon University e.g. -LSB- 4 , 5 , 8 -RSB- , Plume 's approach to parsing is based on semantic caseframe instantiation .
This has the advantages of efficiency on grammatical input , and robustness in the face of ungrammatical input .
While Plume is well adapted to simple declarative and imperative utterances , it handles passives , relative clauses and interrogatives in an ad hoc manner leading to patchy syntactic coverage .
This paper outlines Plume as it currently exists and describes our detailed design for extending Plume to handle passives , relative clauses , and interrogatives in a general manner .

summary: We have implemented a restricted domain parser called Plume . Building on previous work at Carnegie-Mellon University e.g. -LSB- 4 , 5 , 8 -RSB- , Plume 's approach to parsing is based on semantic caseframe instantiation . This has the advantages of efficiency on grammatical input , and robustness in the face of ungrammatical input . While Plume is well adapted to simple declarative and imperative utterances , it handles passives , relative clauses and interrogatives in an ad hoc manner leading to patchy syntactic coverage . This paper outlines Plume as it currently exists and describes our detailed design for extending Plume to handle passives , relative clauses , and interrogatives in a general manner .

Predicate-implemented.label: implemented
Predicate-implemented.description: To implement a predicate means to put into effect or bring something into being. It indicates the subject's action of making something happen or creating an outcome that brings about the object.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates a relationship where the subject (a concept, method, or theory) relies on or draws inspiration from the object (another concept, method, or theory). This connection suggests that the subject has been influenced by, built upon, or grounded in the ideas, principles, or approaches represented by the object.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a possession or association relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject possesses, owns, or has control over the characteristics, attributes, or qualities described by the object.

Predicate-handles.label: handles
Predicate-handles.description: The predicate 'handles' indicates a relationship where the subject has control or management over the object. It suggests that the subject is responsible for directing, governing, or overseeing the actions or processes described by the object.

Predicate-outlines.label: outlines
Predicate-outlines.description: To outline means to define or describe the main points and structure of something, typically a concept, idea, or plan. The predicate 'outlines' connects the subject (the thing being described) with its object (the description or framework), indicating that the subject's essence is captured in the object.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates that the subject provides an explanation or characterization of the object. It establishes a relationship between the subject's content (or perspective) and the object, conveying what the subject says about it.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (a concept or entity) is related to another concept or entity that encompasses it, providing a more general category or classification.
